dialogues.text: Sam! What a surprise. — SAM “ I‘ll bet it is. Especially since you told Mrs. Brady you didn’t want to see me.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Sam, it’s not that. It’s just that this isn’t the right time. Sam puts the package down on the table in front of Alice.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (suave) And three pounds of filet mignon won’t change your mind? Rocky comes out from the door which Sam knows leads to Alice’s bedroom. .

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I think the lady has made it clear she wants you to leave.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: What difference does it make? Why don’t you just blow out of here?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (in disbelief) Alice, you got a new boyfriend? Just because I wanted to go bowling?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Sam, I can’t explain right now. Things are different. That’s all. You better leave.

dialogues.speaker: . SAM
dialogues.text: Alice, I know what that door leads to. (to Rocky) Answer me one question, pal. Did you stay over last night?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, and what if I did? Sam spins away. The news has crushed hin.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Oh, Alice. Oh, no. We’ve been going together for eleven years, and I never stayed over. Not once. And just because I forgot about Amateur Night and the Bowling Butchers need me, you... He can’t say any more. He starts to exit kitchen, returns to retrieve the package of meat, and exits. He retraces his steps through the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam crosses to Mike and Carol.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: . (continuing) . I loved her, Mr. and Mrs. Brady. I let the best thing that ever happened to me get away. Now I know how ground round feels going through the grinder. On that awful imagery, Sam leaves.

dialogues.speaker: THE BRADYS
dialogues.text: They are upset about Sam/Alice, and also discouraged as this possible chance at rescue has disappeared. cuT TO  65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky is near the chart and he is putting the day’s event together.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Okay, which of you is going to the Little League game? Bobby and Peter raise their hands. Mike eventually raises his as well.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: It’s my game. Peter keeps score and Dad is the coach.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I was going there after my meeting on the big Riverside project.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: What about the Sunflower Girls? Where’s the meeting?

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: It’s here.

dialogues.speaker: CINDY
dialogues.text: Mommy’s the troop leader.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Little League games. Sunflower Girl meetings. You people make me sick.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Dad, they’re. just involved with their kids.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: So? I’m involved with you, ain’t I?

dialogues.speaker: . JUNIOR
dialogues.text: It’s not the same.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Who asked you? (back to the matter at hand) . Okay, here’s the way it’s gonna be. Junior, you go to the Little League game with dad and the two boys. I’11 stay here with Clarence and watch Mom and everybody else.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: He crosses to Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Could I talk to you for a second?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah. What is it, kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Greg pulls Rocky into...

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I’m not going to the Sunflower Girl meeting. I’ve got to go out.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: It wasn’t on the chart.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: It’s something Mom and Dad don’t know about.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: You mean, it’s something you shouldn’t be doing?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: There’s hope for you yet, kid. I/11 get you out. They exit the laundry room, and re-enter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To see...

dialogues.speaker: THE FAMILY, JUNIOR AND CLARENCE
dialogues.text: watching the news on TV.

dialogues.speaker: TV NEWSCASTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Here’s a further update on the prison escape by Rocky Portugal and Clarence Dawkins.  67

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Rocky hears this and...

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Turn it up louder. Peter does so. All activity stops as they all crowd in to watch the TV.

dialogues.speaker: TV NEWSCASTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Police have announced in Santa Monica that’ they found the burned remains of the car belonging to Portugal’s son, Junior. Both Portugals and Clarence Dawkins are considered armed and dangerous and are believed to be in the local area. Use extreme caution. In other news, actress Elizabeth Taylor marries for the fifth time and swears this time it’s going to last. Rocky turns off the TV and turns to Junior.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY /
dialogues.text: I told you using your car was dumb.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Sorry, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: A lot of good "sorry" does. (to Mike) Kids drive you nuts. They just can’t learn how to do things right. THE PHONE RINGS. Carol goes to answer it. Rocky is immediately on alert. He follows her to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed, it is a vast dirt area near a riverside. The foundation has already been dug and large construction tractors are standing by for the next phase. MR. PHILLIPS Mike’s boss, is there with TWO BUSINESSMEN. He is using a construction crew phone and is angry. .

dialogues.speaker: MR. PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Carol, this is Harry Phillips.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Oh, hi, Mr. Phillips.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Where exactly is your husband? Carol is very nervous, but tries to remain calm.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: He‘s here.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: That‘s the problem. He’s supposed to be here.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: I better let him explain.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: If that’s possible. Mike takes a breath and takes the phone. Rocky is nearby, gun poised.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Phillips.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Brady, do you know what you’re doing at home? You are risking blowing this whole deal. This multimillion dollar eal.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (on the phone) I realize that, but...

dialogues.speaker: MR. PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Get down here right away. Mike turns to Rocky, desperately upset.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: He wants me to go down there right away.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Tell him you can’t.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: But he’s my boss. What can I say?

dialogues.speaker: MARCIA
dialogues.text: Try "something suddenly came up." It always works for me. Like when I want to break a date.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Not now, honey.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Rocky now

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (forcefully) Tell him.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Believe me, Mr. Phillips, I’d really like to be there with you, but "something suddenly came up" --

dialogues.speaker: MR. PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: What?! Our whole company’s future rests on this project, and you say something suddenly came up?!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Yes, that’s what I’m saying. enjoys the position he’s putting Mike in.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Tell him you're sick of him and his whole small time company.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (waving his gun) Tell him.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Please accept this in a positive way, Mr. Phillips, but I’m sick of you ang your whole small time company.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Brady, I was thinking of making you a partner. Now, if I can do it legally, I‘1ll have your license revoked as an architect.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Mr. Phillips, please don’t --

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (loving this) Call him a rotten scum-bucket.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (horrified) I can’t. Rocky holds a gun up to Carol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call him a rotten scum-bucket, or I/11 kill your wife. Mike sees he has absolutely no alternative.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (weakly) Mr. Phillips, one more thing. (practically sobbing) You’re a rotten scum-bucket. Phillips hangs up, turns to the waiting businessmen.

dialogues.speaker: MR. PHILLIPS
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, there’s been a slight delay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is crushed as he hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC
dialogues.text: Mike, Junior, Peter, and Bobby are walking toward the res of Bobby’s team, THE ANGELS. Bobby is in uniform. Mike has an Angel shirt and cap. Junior wears a windbreaker and has a gun in his belt so the weapon won‘t be seen. Mike is still dazed from the events of the day. They pass a BAG LADY near a refreshment stand, with discarded items in a shopping cart.

dialogues.speaker: BAG LADY
dialogues.text: (her hand out) Mr. Brady, you always have something for me.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (too occupied) Sorry. Not now.

dialogues.speaker: . JUNIOR
dialogues.text: You’ve got to forgive my father, Mr. Brady. He’s really not such a bad guy. He’s robbed stores and banks, but he’s never shot anybody yet.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: He’s going to end up back in prison. You know that, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: . JUNIOR
dialogues.text: He’s had a tough life. His parents never wanted him. Reform school when he was thirteen.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What about your life? Are you ready to see that flushed away, too? If you stick with him ~~

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mr. Brady. But my father is my father, and that’s it. (patting the gun)..: You guys try anything,. and it’s over. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. We/’ve got it. Mike, Peter, Bobby and Junior reach the stands where OTHE PARENTS sit. Peter and Junior sit as Mike and Bobby head to the field. cut TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol, Alice, Marcia, Jan and Cindy wait uneasily as Rock and Greg approach Carol.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Mom, Greg and me are going to run an errand. CAROL . ; What? Greg, you’re not leaving us in the house with this man. (indicates Clarence)

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about Clarence, unless you try something stupid.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Mom, we’ll be back in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Just remember... (to Clarence) Clarence... Taking the cue from Rocky, Clarence picks up the ceramic horse, and smashes it against his head. Greg and Rocky exit, and Carol, Alice and the three girls are impressed and terrified by the impassive Clarence.

dialogues.speaker: THE UMPIRE
dialogues.text: BELLINGHAM, the umpire, a gruff no-nonsense sort, is filling in his line-up sheet.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Mike is desperately trying to come up with a way to save his family when he sees the Umpire. He gets an idea, and crosses to Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Bobby, that umpire is Bellingham, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Sure is, Dad. Toughest in the league.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: He's an ex-cop, isn’t he?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hey, that’s right. Mike has suddenly discovered a plan to help his family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Clarence observing the proceedings, the room is now filled with Sunflower Girls and Sunflower Girls’ Mothers. All are standing in a circle. All the little girls are in uniform -- including Cindy -- and are singing "The Sunflower Girl Song".

dialogues.speaker: ALL ASSEMBLED
dialogues.text: "I’m glad to be a Sunflower Girl, I wear my banner proud, If someone needs my help one day, I‘ll help if I’m allowed. Sunflower Girls are filled with love, They-shine both night and day, I’ll live my life the best I can And‘ live it the Sunflower way. I’1l live my life the whole whole while, Smiling the Sunflower smile."

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: He watches, and shows no emotion.

dialogues.speaker: MARCIA AND JAN
dialogues.text: They are off to one side and looking for an opportunity to somehow end their captivity.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Carol is the leader.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Very good, Sunflower Girls. First I’m sure we’d all like to give a big Sunflower Girl hello to Cindy’s sisters and former Sunflower Girls, Marcia and Jan.

dialogues.speaker: ALL ASSEMBLED
dialogues.text: Hello, Marcia, and Jan!

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: And also we’re very lucky to have another guest today. our old family friend... (at a loss, looks to Clarence)

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: (quickly) Kareem.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Everyone looks at Clarence. ANGLE - CLARENCE - GROUP’S POV He gives a reluctant wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So can we have a big Sunflower Girl "Hello Kareem"?

dialogues.speaker: ALL ASSEMBLED
dialogues.text: Hello, Kareem. Embarrassed and awkward, Clarence nods. cuT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rocky pull up to a corner in the Brady station wagon. Wendy, Betsy, and Kimberly are waiting -- no longe in cheerleader outfits. They jump into the back seat, but they are concerned when they see Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's your friend, Greg? Nobody’s supposed to know about this.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. Uncle Jerry is cool.

dialogues.speaker: BETSY
dialogues.text: Did you tell him what we’re doing?

dialogues.speaker: GREG -
dialogues.text: Yeah, and he’s going to help us.

dialogues.speaker: BETSY
dialogues.text: That’s great. WENDY . Last year, Greg stole the school mascot from Coolidge High before the big game. It was a goat.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: This year we’re helping him steal the mascot from Ridgewood.

dialogues.speaker: BETSY
dialogues.text: It’s a razorback.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Uncle Jerry thinks it’s a great idea.

dialogues.speaker: BETSY
dialogues.text: (to Rocky) You think it’s okay to steal a mascot.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I think it’s okay to steal anything... as long as you have a good reason. The girls laugh.

dialogues.speaker: THE STANDS
dialogues.text: Peter and Junior are really hitting it off quite well.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You know something, Junior, it’s not the prize itself that’s so important.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: You mean the contest at The Hollywood Bowl?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Yeah. This is Mom and Dad’s fifth anniversary. And the prize is perfect for them.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Fifth anniversary? You got six kids, and the youngest is eight.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Well, she’s not my real: mom.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: She’s not?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It’s a long story. She was a lovely lady who was bringing up three very lovely girls --

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: And what happened?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Well, one day this lady met a fellow, who was busy with three boys of his own. That’s how we became the Brady Bunch.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: The Brady Bunch?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Yeah. That’s how we all hecame the Brady Bunch. cuT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sunflower Girls and mother are all playing the memory game. A plump Sunflower Girl, OLIVIA, sits next to Clarence and is reciting...

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: I went to the zoo and I saw a monkey, an elephant, a rhinocerous, a giraffe with a long neck. ~ (adding her own) .»..and a camel with two humps.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Good. Who’s next?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I’m next. I went to the zoo, and I saw a monkey, an elephant, a rhinocerous, a giraffe with a long neck... a camel with two humps... (adds her own) ».,and a great big tiger...

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Good, Laurie. Who’s next?

dialogues.speaker: SUNFLOWER MOTHER
dialogues.text: How about Kareem? All eyes turn to Clarence.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: SUNFLOWER MOTHER
dialogues.text: Sure. All new guests have to play. It’s the Sunflower Girls way of making you feel welcome.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: (uncertainly) Well...

dialogues.speaker: SUNFLOWER MOTHER
dialogues.text: Kareem should play? Right, Sunflower Girls? The Sunflower Girls all adlib agreement. Cindy is forced to appeal to hin.

dialogues.speaker: CINDY
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) Please, Kareen. Clarence gives in to the pressure.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: (awkwardly) I went to the zoo and I saw a monkey, an elephant, a rhinocerous, a giraffe with a long neck... a camel with two humps... a great big tiger... (adds his own) : ..-And a black and white zebra, all locked in their cells. (then) I mean, cages. A lot of innocent animals in cages. The others all are puzzled by this as we: cuT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg, Rocky, and the three pom pom girls pull up in the station wagon next to the gym. Painted boldly on a sign on a chain link fence: It’s a cartoon of a razorback. ANGLE - GREG’S POV The gym is behind a locked chain link fence and a STUDENT GUARD is a posted sentry.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That’s what I heard. They’re guarding the razorback.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Probably because of what you did last year.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: BETSY s Check out that big lock. i

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY /
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, girls. Leave it to Uncle - Jerry. cUuT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plywood platform is pushed to the side. The Sunflower Girls are lined up for a three legged race.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: The winners get to take home the extra chocolate chip cookies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice can be seen baking cookies through the screen.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA AND HER PARTNER
dialogues.text: They can practically smell the cookies from the backyard. Talk about incentive.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC
dialogues.text: The Olivia team is leading. Various mothers root for thei daughters.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: He’s an observer, on the watch for any false moves, and is starting to smile more and more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Olivia team wins! Clarence is happier than anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is on the mound. Bases are loaded. He throws a wild pitch.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: nae 79

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BELLINGHAM’ : Ball four. Take your base. The batter goes to first. A run walks in. The next batter strides confidently to the plate. Bobby winds up and throws a pitch that soars over the backstop.

dialogues.speaker: THE REFRESHMENT STAND
dialogues.text: The ball smashes into a pyramid display of soft drink can and knocks them all over.

dialogues.speaker: BELLINGHAM
dialogues.text: (continuing) Time out. The Umpire walks out to the mound, and signals for Mike to come from the dugout. BELLINGHAM.’ (continuing) Brady, get your kid out: of here before he kills somebody.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You’re an ex-cop, right? I need help.

dialogues.speaker: BELLINGHAM
dialogues.text: Your pitcher is the one who needs help. Mike looks toward the stands. ANGLE - PETER AND JUNIOR - MIKE’S POV Junior senses something fishy, and stares at Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (quickly) It’s a matter of life and death.

dialogues.speaker: BELLINGHAM
dialogues.text: Get somebody else out here, or it will be. Mike knows he can’t stay any longer. He signals to the shortstop to take over. Mike returns to the dugout. cuT TO  80

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg enters, and stops at the chain link fence to talk to the Student Guard.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: How’s it going?

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT GUARD
dialogues.text: (instantly suspicious) Hey, you’re Greg Brady. You’re the guy who stole the mascot from Coolidge High. Greg sees the padlock and fiddles with it.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Wow! You’re making sure nobody steals this mascot?

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT GUARD
dialogues.text: That’s right. I suggest you get lost. Right now.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHEERLEADERS
dialogues.text: The three girls swoop in, and elirtatiously get close to the Student Guard.

dialogues.speaker: BETSY
dialogues.text: Hiya, cutie.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: I‘m surprised you’re not on the football team instead of guarding the mascot.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT GUARD
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. I know you girls. You’re the cheerleaders his team.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Come on, girls, we’ll never get past this guy. But before they can take a step away...

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: He comes up to the mascot guard.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Good work, son. (to Greg and the girls) You kids get moving.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ad 81

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Greg and the Cheerleaders exit.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: What’s your name, son?

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT GUARD
dialogues.text: Chuck Alpert.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I’m proud of you, Chuck. I think you saved the Ridgewood mascot for the big game.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT GUARD
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Get up the administration building, and bring back form 862. That’s a special commendation. I want to reward you for excellent work. 1/11 take care of things until you get back. Immediately, the Student Guard steps away from the fenced area, and hurries off.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (quickly) . I’ve got to tell you something about my Uncle Jerry, he’s --

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: (interrupts) He’s the best. None of my relatives would ever ‘help me steal anything.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: But there’s something more important.

dialogues.speaker: BETSY
dialogues.text: Yeah, we got to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (desperately) Listen -- But the three girls hurry to join Rocky at the locked gat Greg has no alternative but to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: non! 82

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Rocky takes a hairpin from one of the cheerleader’s hair, and quickly picks the padlock. They all enter the fenced area, then enter the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Rocky, and the Cheerleaders like a commando unit approach the cage which holds the razorback. Greg takes a rope from his jacket pocket, and opens the cage. He gingerly ties the rope around the animal’s neck, and brin it out of its cage.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Watch out for their tusks. They charge at you, and they’re vicious. The Cheerleaders make appropriately squeamish sounds, but happily join Greg and Rocky as they take their ‘conquest out of the gym.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Mike, Peter, Bobby and Junior are leaving. The four pass the refreshment stand where they had passed the Bag Lady when they entered. She puts her hand out to Mike again.

dialogues.speaker: BAG LADY
dialogues.text: How about now?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (curtly) Not now. They walk off.

dialogues.speaker: BAG LADY

dialogues.text: GREG ‘ I’ve gotta hide the razorback in the garage so my folks won’t see hin.

dialogues.text: The Sunflower Girls meeting: girls, mothers and Clarence.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY AND GREG
dialogues.text: They enter the backyard. Rocky crosses the yard, and sees a basket on the barbecue. The basket is marked: "Sunflower Girl Dues". He quickly helps himself to the money, and puts it in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: She sees what Rocky has done, and crosses to him.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: How can you do that? That money belongs to the Sunflower Girls.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Are you okay, Greg?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Everything’s fine, Mom. Carol moves to rejoin her guests as Jan talks to Greg and Marcia.  84

dialogues.speaker: SUNFLOWER GIRL MOTHER
dialogues.text: Kareem, it was a pleasure meeting you. Some men just have a way with children.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: They’ve only got one gun now. I’ve got a plan how we can take these guys.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: Count me in.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA

dialogues.speaker: CHARLOTTE

Quickly, Rocky moves to take the slip of paper awa - from Olivia. He looks at it. ‘ ROCKY . Hmmm. . (meaningfully) Alice should have been more careful. As the girls and their mothers look at this new stranger.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY

dialogues.speaker: SUNFLOWER GIRL MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Thank you. None the wiser, the Sunflower Girls and mothers exit.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: "Kareem is an escaped convict. Call the police." (then) Some fortune cookie.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: I don’t think you're so tough! I think you’d make a real cute Sunflower Girl.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY -
dialogues.text: Hey, don’t get me mad. Just because you’re a kid that don’t mean you’re safe. Rocky pulls out the gun and starts to rush the stairs. Greg -- according to plan -- blocks him. Marcia does a cheerleader flip down the stairs and ends with a cartwhee in which she knocks the gun from Rocky’s hand. The gun flies through the air and lands at Cindy’s feet.

dialogues.text: Ne 86

dialogues.speaker: CAROL

dialogues.text: (down) Hi, Honey. We/’re home.

dialogues.speaker: . ROCKY

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY .

Rocky is with them. He wears Jan’s black wig. He’s wearing one of Mike’s fancy sport shirts, open in a large "Vv" to rev several gold chains around his neck. He’s also wearing dark glasses. The hand with the tattoo is in his pocket, accompanied by the ever-present gun. The EMCEE of the event, in tuxedo, approaches.

dialogues.text: Clarence enters. The razorback is snarling. Carol enters the kitchen, and cautiously moves to a cupboard. She retrieves a bottle of Wesson Oil.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: This stuff is good for everything. She spills it onto the kitchen floor. The razorback start to charge Clarence, but its legs go out from under it. It slips and slides all around the kitchen. Carol gets a jump rope from the closet, and tosses it to Clarence.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Here. Clarence tries to do just that, but he, too, slips and slides on the oil. Carol seizes -this opportunity to try to escape. She starts toward the back door, but slips on the oil, too. In the ensuing slipping and sliding on the floor, the razorback’s tusk cuts Clarence’s hand. Carol sees this, and is torn between escaping and helping Clarence, who is bleeding.

dialogues.text: Look what the dogs did! Will somebody clean (eBent this stage? © e And the wianer of this ‘year’s Los Angeles Parks and Recreation Competition is The Silver Platters.

dialogues.text: See!

dialogues.speaker: THE AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Applauding.  96

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Our parents. We wanted to win this for their wedding anniversary.

dialogues.speaker: EMCEE

dialogues.speaker: EMCEE
dialogues.text: Let’s hear it for this lucky couple with these six great kids. What a perfect pair! Don’t be shy. Give her a kiss. Mike shrugs, and kisses Alice.

dialogues.speaker: EMCEE
dialogues.text: Isn‘t that wonderful, folks? (applauds)

dialogues.text: (desperately, whispers to Emcee) He Listen, you’ve got to help me. (pointing.to Rocky) That guy over there is --

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: As he comes out on stage.  97

dialogues.speaker: THE AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: As they applaud.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY

dialogues.text: They begin to leave The Bowl.

dialogues.speaker: SAM AND DARRYL L

dialogues.text: You were great! I knew you’d win, Marcia. MARCIA . Thanks, Darryl.

dialogues.text: Sorry, Sam. I understand how you feel, but what was important to you was your 123 average.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL .
dialogues.text: Marcia, I just want you to know I/11 always be there for you. I’m just sorry you like him -- i (indicating Junior) -- better than me.

dialogues.speaker: MARCIA
dialogues.text: Darryl, I’m afraid that’s the way it has to be. But at least -- (very dramatic) -- we'll always have the Junior Prom.

dialogues.text: Rocky and Junior hustle the Bradys and Alice towards The Bowl exit, leaving Sam and Darryl.

dialogues.text: They look at each other. Then... SAM . Looks like we’ve lost ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: No way. Darryl quickly follows Junior and grabs him. Rocky sees this.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Buzz off, kid.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: Marcia means too much to me.

dialogues.text: Rocky and Junior are detained by Darryl. In the big crowd Mike sees an opportunity, and decides to go for it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (to his family and Alice) Come on. Let’s go. They dash for the car.  99

dialogues.speaker: SAM, DARRYL, ROCKY AND JUNIOR

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Dad, let me drive.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Greg, I drive a lot safer than you do.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I know, Dad. I know! Greg takes the keys. Mike lets him. They pile in, and screech away.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY AND JUNIOR
dialogues.text: They can’t find a car with keys.» Then they are in luck. A lady (looking very much like Shirley Jones) is getting out of a psychedelically painted bus (looking very much like "The Partridge Family" transport). They grab her keys, and knock her out of the way.

dialogues.text: Rocky is at the wheel as he and Junior pull out of the Bo parking lot to give chase. cuT TO

dialogues.speaker: . CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Nobody’s ever done that before.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Bandaged your hand?

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: No. I’ve had lots of bandages. Heck, every time I get shot, I get a bandage.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Then what do you mean? CLARENCE . Nobody’s ever been nice to me before. cuT. TO

dialogues.speaker: CINDY 7
dialogues.text: They’‘ve got a bus. And all we have is , a car. iC This gives Greg an idea.

dialogues.text: Greg speeds through the wash which is big enough to allow acar, but not big enough for a bus. Rocky attempts to follow, but the bus is too wide, and gets wedged in the machinery.

dialogues.speaker: THE STATION WAGON
dialogues.text: The Bradys pull out of the car wash, and head home.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Be quiet, and be careful.

dialogues.text: Clarence and Carol are watching a "Gilligan’s Island" | rerun. It’s the episode where Don Rickles, as a convict, is holding all the Castaways hostage. Clarence is laughin heartily.

dialogues.text: MIKE “ Blood! I’m going to kill him! Mike rushes in.

dialogues.text: Honey, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: . CAROL
dialogues.text: Mike, I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: But the blood.

dialogues.text: It’s my blood.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL.

dialogues.text: (bluffing) Oh, the police caught them. We just came home to give you a chance to get away, Clarence. Get out of here while you still have time.

dialogues.text: “(continuing) Nice try, Dad. cuT TO

dialogues.text: Sam and Darryl are at a table. A TV set is televising a sporting event with no sound. Sam is drowning his trouble with a pitcher of beer. Darryl is finishing a bottle of Coke. *

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Take it from me, kid. You can’t trust women. Not only does Alice drop me for some clown she just met, she forgets my bowling average. 123. That’s more than any man can take. My average is 136. If she knew one thing about me --it’s my bowling average.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: I loved Marcia. I really did. Sure, I know she thinks she’s perfect, but it’s not her fault. She’s a Brady. He takes out his senior prom picture.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: Look at her. Isn’t she beautiful? The theme of the senior prom was Moon River. You’d think she’d remember it was the senior prom not the junior prom. As Darryl is lost in the thought. Sam looks over Darryl’s shoulder and sees the TV screen.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: And it’s all because of hin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: . (pointing) Him. That guy I saw her with.

dialogues.text: Darryl calls to a BARTENDER.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: Turn up the volume, would you? The bartender gets a chair and grouses...

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Someday, somebody’s going to invent a way |50 they won’t have to do this by hand. He turns up the volume. o

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ---and is still believed to be in the neighborhood. Remember Rocky Portugal has a distinctive tattoo on his right hand. It’s the numbers 1--2--3. With him is Clarence Dawkins. “ ANGLE - SAM AND DARRYL SAM ‘ 1-2-3? That’s him! 1-2-3. That’s it. Alice was trying to tell me. I knew she couldn’t forget my bowling average. It’s not 1-2-3. It’s 1-3-6.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Now a high school year book photo of Junior.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Believed to be with Dawkins and Portugal is Rocky’s son, Rocky Junior. If you see either of these men, please contact the police immediately.  105

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: "Junior?". That’s it. Marcia knew it was the senior prom. She was trying to tell me about Junior. Darryl and Sam look at each other, then spring to their feet and run toward the door. Sam throws a bill at the bartender as they disappear out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky, Junior, and Clarence are putting all the Bradys an Alice in the attic, a place filled with various articles from various "Brady" episodes.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: You people just keep making it worse for yourselves. Now we have to leave you up here in the attic till Monday. CAROL . Tomorrow’s Sunday. We all go to church.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Mom’s in the choir.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: There’s a surprise. (then) This week you skip church. Don’t worry. I‘1l write you a note. (to Junior and Clarence) C’mon, boys. The three men exit, leaving the Bradys to mull their fate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence moves a huge credenza in front of the door to th attic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg looks out the window. He looks back to report.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: a

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: It’s a straight drop of twenty feet. Maybe more.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: If we lower Bobby, he can alert the neighbors.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Twenty feet? I’m afraid of heights.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Not just you, Bobby. The whole family will work together on this. (to Carol) Honey, give me your hands. Alice, take Mrs. Brady’s. We/’1ll be the anchors up here in the attic. Immediately, a human chain begins with Mike, Carol and Alice as the anchor. They move toward the window.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (continuing) Bobby, when you get down, run next door to the Dittmeyer’s, and phone the police.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Right, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The oddest of sights. Down the straight wall of the house are the six Brady kids linked by arms to legs as they low toward the ground. Greg’s arms are inside the window, where Alice, Mike and Carol support most of the weight. Peter holds on to Greg’s legs, Marcia holds onto Peter’s legs, Jan holds onto Marcia’s legs, Bobby holds onto Jan’s legs, Cindy holds onto Bobby’s legs.

dialogues.speaker: JAN AND MARCIA
dialogues.text: Jan’s hands start to slip.

dialogues.speaker: MARCIA
dialogues.text: Jan, hold on. Hold on tight.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: You need me?

dialogues.speaker: MARCIA
dialogues.text: Of course I need you. We all need you, Jan.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: And you really like me?

dialogues.speaker: MARCIA
dialogues.text: Yes, I really like you, ‘but can we talk about this later? We’re hanging from the roof.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: (to herself) They like me, they really like me. with great effort, Jan regains her grip on Marcia’s legs.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Cindy and Bobby are almost to the ground. Bobhy drops the last few feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To reveal Clarence, Rocky and Junior. Bobby falls into the arms of Clarence, who catches him. They’ve been waiting for just such an escape attempt.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (calls up to Mike) You folks just don’t give up. Okay, everybody into the living room. Suddenly, the kids all fall into a heap on the grass at Rocky’s feet. cuUT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bradys are depressed as. they wait for the full force of Rocky’s wrath.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Well, another escape attempt goes up in smoke.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Mrs. Brady, do you know why your kids were so anxious to win first prize? Two round trip tickets to Paris were going to be for you. For your anniversary.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It’s true, dear.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Carol melts when she hears this.’ In spite of the threat from Rocky, Carol and Mike embrace their six kids, huggin them, kissing them, thanking them. |

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Ain’t that something. | Rocky sees Clarence, who is clearly moved by the sense of family.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Clarence, you’re not getting soft on me, are you?

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: I can’t help it. They’re Bradys.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I’m getting sick to my stomach.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Dad, why don’t you and Clarence give yourselves up?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Are you both nuts or something? On Monday, I waltz into the bank with Brady, and waltz out with his dough. We get a car, and we’re on our way.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: You’ll be caught, Dad. I don’t want to see you caught, and put back in prison. You’re my dad; I care about you the same way the Bradys care about each other. Junior embraces Rocky. Clarence embraces both of then. Junior pulls out the map he drew.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: (continuing) That’s the only reason I drew this map to break you out in the first place. So we could be together. Mike looks at the map that Junior is waving.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You drew this map?

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why? Mike examines it more closely.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MIKE ‘ By hand? i

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: It was perfect, too. Junior’s not much of a crook, but he sure can make a map.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: This has all the specs of the air conditioning ducts, the water mains, and electric cables. This shows a real understanding of architecture.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: It does?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: With some schooling and training I think Junior has the makings of a real architect. :

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY -
dialogues.text: My kid?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC
dialogues.text: SWAT TEAM POLICE arrives and advances on the house with weapons drawn. With the LIEUTENANT are Sam and Darryl.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: You think they’re inside?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: sop, (angry) oe . Right. That guy’s inside with my Alice. You've got to do something, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Is there a back way?

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: Yeah, but Mr. Brady locks all the doors. One time when I brought Marcia back after curfew, I... (then realizing) Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: se? wl 110

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Lieutenant takes a bullhorn.: LIEUTENANT i (bullhorn) Rocky, this is Lieutenant Whitfield. We Know you and Clarence and Junior are in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hear the hear the bullhorn and freeze. Rocky goes to the window and breaks the glass.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (yelling) We’re not coming out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIEUTENANT’ (bullhorn) a I can’t hear you, Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I said we’re not coming out!

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: (bullhorn) What? Bobby volunteers...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I’ve got a bullhorn.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Get it. Bobby runs upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: (bullhorn) Send out the Bradys and you won’t get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: What about Alice? How come nobody thinks about Alice?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LIEUTENANT’ (bullhorn) The place is surrounded, Rocky. You : haven’t got a chance.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: (to the Lieutenant) Tell him just to send out Marcia. Bobby returns with a toy bullhorn and gives it to Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (bullhorn) No way are you taking me alive. We didn’t break out of prison to go back. Right, Clarence?

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: I don’t know, Rocky. I’ve been thinking about a new line of work. Maybe something with kids.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: You’re pathetic. _

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: (bullhorn) What do you want, Rocky?

dialogues.speaker: . ROCKY
dialogues.text: (bullhorn) I want...I want... (then to the Bradys) What do I want? Brady adlibs fly: "A million dollars," “a helicopter," "a doll house," "tickets to the Super Bowl," etc. Then Rocky looks at his son, Junior.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: What do you really want, Rocky?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (to Mike) Were you serious about Junior having what it takes to be an architect?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: And you’d help him?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Any way I could. “CONTINUED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we Me 112

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED, (2)
dialogues.text: Before Rocky can turn back to make a request, TEAR GAS CANNISTERS fly through the window into the kitchen. The gas flows into the living room and forces the Bradys, Rocky, Junior and Clarence to cry as they continue. Cloud of tear gas continue to fill the room. They’re all in tears as they continue.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Junior, you know I only want what’s best for you.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I didn’t turn out to be a good crook, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: MARCIA AND JAN
dialogues.text: In tears from the tear gas.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: I promise not to be so jealous of you, Marcia. ,

dialogues.speaker: MARCIA
dialogues.text: I’ll try to be more considerate.

dialogues.speaker: GREG AND PETER
dialogues.text: In tears.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Peter, I promise to let you sing the solo part some time.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: And I promise to stop eavesdropping when you’re talking to girls.

dialogues.speaker: CINDY AND BOBBY
dialogues.text: Sobbing from the tear gas.

dialogues.speaker: CINDY
dialogues.text: Bobby, I’11 stop running through the halls at school.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: And I’ll stop turning you in to the principal.  113

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, CAROL AND ALICE
dialogues.text: All weeping.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (to Carol) I forgive you for the dent in the fender.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: (to Mike) I thought you made that dent, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: It was me, folks, taking my first driving lesson.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY AND JUNIOR
dialogues.text: They are crying also.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: You know why I have this tattoo on my hand? . a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: It’s your birthday, son. January 23rd. 1/2/3.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: My birthday! Oh, Dad! The blubbering men embrace. The Bradys are sobbing as well. . :

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: 1,2,3 is Junior’s birthday. (she cries even harder)

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: (sobbing) I was his cellmate, and he never even” told me.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: (bullhorn) Come on out, Rocky. Rocky goes to the window. nth

dialogues.speaker: THE SKY
dialogues.text: A helicopter has now joined the police team. It shines a light down on the proceedings.

dialogues.speaker: ROCK
dialogues.text: (bullhorn) I’11l_ come out first, but I need to know you’ll let my kid off. He didn’t have nothing to do with this.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: (bullhorn) He broke you out, Rocky. I can’t promise anything. Mike crosses to Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Rocky, the police can’t honor that kind of deal. Nicholas Despreaux once said, “Honor is like an island, rugged and without a beach; once we have left it, we can never return.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR .
dialogues.text: Gee, your old man knows what everybody said about everything.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Personally, I think he makes up most of that stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the people from the various Brady activities are — gathered outside the Brady house to see what’s happening: cheerleaders, teachers, cops, coaches, Sunflower Girls an Mothers. Even the Bag Lady.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: Rocky and Clarence cross to the front door. Junior quickl joins him there. .

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (bullhorn) Okay, I’m coming out!

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Be careful. They might plug you, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Everybody has to die some time.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Lieutenant signals to his men’ to aim at the front do The door opens, and Rocky cleverly pushes Mike outside. The police open fire and wound Mike in the arm. (

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: That’s Mr. Brady!

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Hold your fire. The police stop. shooting. They run in and surround the wounded Mike. Carol comforts her husband. Rocky and Clarence step out. They are immediately grabbed and taken into custody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family and Alice step out as Junior is taken into custody as well.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (calls) — . : Read them their rights. The Bag Lady approaches Carol.

dialogues.speaker: BAG LADY
dialogues.text: Your husband is the bravest man I ever saw.

dialogues.speaker: CAROL
dialogues.text: Of course. He’s a Brady.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER AND THE RAZORBACK
dialogues.text: Both belch, as they drink at Tiger’s beer~-filled bowl.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Poor Junior. He’1ll do three years easy.

dialogues.speaker: JAN
dialogues.text: That’s perfect. In three years, I won’t have braces. I/’11 be wearing contact lenses. And I might even have boobs. She brushes her hair back in exaggerated Marcia’s motion.  at Wb 116

dialogues.text: As the excitement continues with the Bradys, the friends and neighbors. CAMERA PULLS BACK AND AWAY as: |
